alert.note: Alert for Coastal Duval; Eastern Clay; Inland Nassau; South Central Duval; Trout River; Western Clay; Western Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:09PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN NASSAU... NORTHWESTERN CLAY AND CENTRAL DUVAL COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Normandy, or near Jacksonville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Orange Park, Hilliard, Callahan, Jacksonville International Arpt, Fleming Island, Cisco Gardens, Ortega, Oakleaf Plantation, and Bellair-Meadowbrook Terrace. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
